{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rinse ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 1/4 cups split yellow pigeon peas","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" with water.
Chop ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2 tomatoes","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" into small blocks (<1cm sq).
Dice ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 large onion","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".
Peel and finely chop ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2 cm fresh ginger","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".
Finely dice ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2 green chilis","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 1/4 cup washed split yellow pigeon peas","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" to a pressure cooker pot with ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"3 cups water","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".\nAdd ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 tsp turmeric powder","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp salt","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 of the chopped tomatoes","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 of the chopped ginger","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2 tbsp chopped onion","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" to the pot.\nClosed the pressure cooker, and put it on the heat. Cook for 10 minutes from when the pressure is reached. Let the pot naturally cool to release the pressure (5-10 minutes).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Note: Wait 4-5 minutes before starting to cook the first tempering. Now is a good time to prepare some of the mixtures of spices in bowls to make for easy addition. If eating with naan, make sure your oven is preheated, and follow the instructions.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

Add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp cumin seeds","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and cook until popping (1-2 minutes).
Add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp ginger","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tbsp garlic paste","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", and saute for 1-2 minutes.
Add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"all but 1 tbsp of the remaining chopped onion","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and saute until golden brown","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":",","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To the tempering add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/8 tsp asafoetida","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 of the chopped green chilis","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Saute for a minute.\nAdd the remaining ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 chopped tomatoes","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", and saute for 3-4 minutes until soft and cooked down.\nAdd ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/2 cup water","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and let it cook down a bit (make sure it doesn't dry out entirely).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To the tempering add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp red chili powder","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp coriander powder","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp garam masala","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tbsp kasuri methi","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp salt ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"(to taste), ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tbsp fresh coriander leaves","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (chopped).\nCook/saute for 2-3 minutes (until aromatic).\nAdd the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"cooked dal mixture","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", mix thoroughly, let it come to a boil, then remove from the heat.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Note: Keep the tempering warm whilst preparing the second tempering (although it should be fine off the heat since the second tempering doesn't take long.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To a small frying pan (tadka pan), add ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2 tbsp oil/ghee","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and heat on a medium/high heat.\nAdd ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1/8 tsp asafoetida","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp cumin seeds","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tablespoon garlic paste","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":",","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"the","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" remaining chopped ginger","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":",","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" 1 tbsp diced onion ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"(set aside in step 3), and saute for 1-2 minutes (until aromatic).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Note: The second tempering takes 3-5 minutes, so think about naan if you're planning on eating with naan.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To the second tempering pan add the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"remaining chopped green chilis","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 bay leaf","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"4 cloves","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"1 tsp red chili powder","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and saute for 1-2 minutes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Note: If the tempering is thick, add more oil/ghee. It should be a mix of ingredients and red oil in the end.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
